intro: Epacris hirtella, commonly known as the woolly epacris, is a species of flowering plant in the heath family, Ericaceae. It is native to southeastern Australia, particularly found in the states of New South Wales and Victoria. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name, and it produces spikes of fragrant, tubular flowers in shades of pink and red. It typically grows in heathlands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Epacris hirtella is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited to coastal and sunny environments.
